citations.narrative:
The enclosure for the peacocks had an area where the nylon mesh was tangled and shredded. This could cause injury to
the birds if they were to become caught in the material. Facilities must be kept in good repair to contain the animals and
protect them from injury. The facility must correct this issue.
******Correct by June 9, 2024

Multiple broken and jagged boards were observed in the shelter building in the bison enclosure. Broken boards can
potentially cause the animals to become injured. Facilities must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to
protect the animals from injury. The facility must correct this issue.
**********Correct by June 9, 2024

Four fox are being housed in an octagon shaped metal wire enclosure with a concrete floor. Multiple enrichment items
were observed in the enclosure, such as a hanging nylon hammock, however many items are not conducive for fox typical
behavior. In addition, this type of enclosure flooring does not provide for the species housed within to exhibit normal
digging behavior and normal postural adjustments. This can affect the welfare and well being of the animals and
ultimately have a negative effect on animal health. The facility must provide a more appropriate enclosure for fox species.
******Correct by June 9, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The enclosure for the peacocks had an area where the nylon mesh was tangled and shredded. This could cause injury to 
the birds if they were to become caught in the material. Facilities must be kept in good repair to contain the animals and 
protect them from injury. The facility must correct this issue.  
******Correct by June 9, 2024 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Multiple broken and jagged boards were observed in the shelter building in the bison enclosure. Broken boards can 
potentially cause the animals to become injured. Facilities must be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to 
protect the animals from injury. The facility must correct this issue.  
**********Correct by June 9, 2024 
3.128 
   
Space requirements. 
Four fox are being housed in an octagon shaped metal wire enclosure with a concrete floor. Multiple enrichment items 
were observed in the enclosure, such as a hanging nylon hammock, however many items are not conducive for fox typical 
behavior. In addition, this type of enclosure flooring does not provide for the species housed within to exhibit normal 
digging behavior and normal postural adjustments. This can affect the welfare and well being of the animals and 
ultimately have a negative effect on animal health. The facility must provide a more appropriate enclosure for fox species.  
******Correct by June 9, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
